beats.label: HOOK + PROMISE
beats.narration: Should you race Torino Nice Rally? I rated 328 gravel races on 14 dimensions. Torino Nice Rally scored 87 out of 100. The Icons tier. Here's what that actually means for your season.
beats.text_on_screen: Should You Race Torino Nice Rally?
beats.editing_note: STATE THE PREMISE IN 8 SECONDS. Clear value prop: 'I rated 328 races. Here's where this one lands.' This is the 8-second decision window. Viewers who stay past 15s are 58% more likely to finish.
beats.psych_mechanism: Curiosity gap (specific) + IKEA effect (viewer predicts the tier before reveal).

beats.label: THE COURSE
beats.narration: Torino Nice Rally. Turin, Italy to Nice, France. 435 mi. A 700km pilgrimage across the Maritime Alps from Turin's Piazza Giambattista Bodoni to Nice's Rifugio Massacan. The route weaves between Italy and France across 10+ major cols, alternating between legendary Tour de France climbs and historic military gravel roads. 65% paved alpine roads, 35% gravel including the sublime Gardetta Pass 'Little Peru' and Via del Sale finale. Every day takes riders over passes above 2,000m. The sweet spot between 2 thousand to 3 thousandm where peaks escape trees and sky becomes more blue.
beats.text_on_screen: Torino Nice Rally | Turin, Italy to Nice, France | 435 mi
beats.editing_note: Let the course breathe. Show the route map, then cut to terrain-specific B-roll. This is the SETUP phase — grounding the viewer before the data analysis. Pacing: 25-40 sec cuts.

beats.label: THE SCORES — Top 8
beats.editing_note: PROGRESSIVE RHYTHM: start tight (15-20 sec per dimension), slow down for the most interesting scores (30-40 sec). Each score: number appears, brief pause, explanation. Avatar reacts to extreme scores (5/5 = chef_kiss, 1/5 = facepalm). RE-ENGAGEMENT at 3:00 mark: insert a surprising score reveal or a meme reaction to break the pattern.

beats.label: LOGISTICS

broll_sources.query: Turin, Italy to Nice, France travel guide

beats.editing_note: Utility section. Lower energy, practical value. Hybrid Tempo: alternate fast logistics items (10-15 sec) with slow map visuals (30 sec).

logistics: Fly into: TRN - start; NCE - finish. Both cities have rail connections from major European hubs.
Lodging: Turin for pre-event. During ride: mountain refuges, small hotels, wild camping at altitude. Rifugio Massacan at Nice finish provides logistics help, shower, and warm welcome.

beats.label: VERDICT
beats.narration: Verdict: The Alpine Pilgrimage. Yes if you want authentic bikepacking adventure without commercial racing pressure. Yes if you appreciate community, charity, and soul over competition. Yes if you're prepared for multi-day Alpine self-sufficiency. Skip if you need race infrastructure and support. Skip if rocky military roads will destroy your pure gravel setup.
beats.editing_note: CLOSE THE MAIN LOOP. 0.5s silence before verdict. Tier badge slams in. Avatar delivers final take. DO NOT signal 'wrapping up' — maintain energy.
